sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词都有"练习，训练，锻炼"之意。
means: drill ： 侧重进行有系统的，严格和重复的练习。
exercise ： 主要指为强壮体魄而进行的锻炼，也可指进行练习以保持已经获得的技巧。
practice ： 指把所学的理论或知识用于实践以获得技艺与技巧。
training ： 普通用词，泛指为从事某种职业而进行的身体或智力方面的训练。
discipline ： 既可指训练又可指为达到某种熟练程度而进行的约束。

word_mean: 操练，运动：增进健康或矫治躯体畸形而作的体育锻练

sentence.Network_en: His exercise books were full of well deserved red ticks.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的练习本上尽是些红钩钩，都是他应得的。

sentence.Network_en: Swimming is probably the best form of exercise you can get.
sentence.Network_cn: 游泳或许是现有的最佳锻炼方式。

sentence.Network_en: A bit of exercise will help lift his spirits.
sentence.Network_cn: 进行一点儿体育锻炼能帮助他改善情绪。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in the sense 'application of a faculty, right, or process'): via Old French from Latin exercitium, from exercere 'keep busy, practise', from ex- 'thoroughly' + arcere 'keep in or away'

entry.def: If you exercise something such as your authority, your rights, or a good quality, you use it or put it into effect.

example.ex: They are merely exercising their right to free speech...
example.tran: 他们只是在行使他们的言论自由权。

example.ex: 'The powers delegated to me,' the President said, 'will be exercised with due responsibility.'...
example.tran: “赋予我的权力，”总统说，“我将尽责履行。”

entry.def: When you exercise, you move your body energetically in order to get fit and to remain healthy.

example.ex: She exercises two or three times a week...
Never keep on exercising if you have even the slightest chest pain...
example.tran: 即使你只感到很轻微的胸部疼痛，也不要继续锻炼。

entry.def: If a movement or activity exercises a part of your body, it keeps it strong, healthy, or in good condition.

example.ex: They call rowing the perfect sport. It exercises every major muscle group.
example.tran: 他们称划船是最佳运动，它可以锻炼每一处主要肌肉群。

entry.def: Exercises are a series of movements or actions which you do in order to get fit, remain healthy, or practise for a particular physical activity.

example.ex: These stomach exercises will tighten abdominal muscles...
example.tran: 这些腹部练习会增强腹肌。

example.ex: I do special neck and shoulder exercises...
example.tran: 我做专门的颈部和肩部运动。

entry.def: Exercises are military activities and operations which are not part of a real war, but which allow the armed forces to practise for a real war.

example.ex: General Powell predicted that in the future it might even be possible to stage joint military exercises...
example.tran: 鲍威尔将军预测将来甚至可能举行联合军事演习。

example.ex: The military truck was taking 14 men on exercise in a remote area of Norway.
example.tran: 那辆军用卡车正载着14名士兵到挪威的一个偏远地区进行操练。

entry.def: An exercise is a short activity or piece of work that you do, for example in school, which is designed to help you learn a particular skill.

example.ex: Try working through the opening exercises in this chapter...
example.tran: 做一做本章节的开篇习题。

example.ex: He took up piano lessons, combining standard classical exercises with his own attempts at Gershwin.
example.tran: 他上钢琴课，一边进行标准的经典作品的练习，一边自己尝试练习格什温的作品。

entry.def: Exercises is an official ceremony, in which people make speeches and present awards.

example.ex: Vicky and Gary attended the graduation exercises at Columbia.
example.tran: 维基和加里参加了哥伦比亚大学的毕业典礼。

entry.def: If you describe an activity as an exercise in a particular quality or result, you mean that it has that quality or result, especially when it was not intended to have it.

example.ex: Her morning was an exercise in indecision. She tried on everything in her closet but couldn't remember what he'd liked...
example.tran: 她整个早晨都犹豫不决。她试穿了衣橱中的所有衣服，却不记得他喜欢哪一件。

example.ex: As an exercise in stating the obvious, this could scarcely be faulted...
example.tran: 这说的都是些显而易见的事情，几乎不可能出错。

entry.def: If something exercises you or your mind, you think or talk about it a great deal, especially because you are worried or concerned about it.

example.ex: This has been a major problem exercising the minds of scientists around the world...
example.tran: 这一直是困扰全世界科学家的一个重要问题。

example.ex: The proper role of appeal judges is an issue that has long exercised the finest legal minds.
example.tran: 上诉法官应当扮演何种角色，这一问题长期以来困扰着那些最出色的法律人士。

means.word_mean: 1. the activity of exerting your muscles in various ways to keep fit;

sentences.sentence: "the physical exertion required by his work kept him fit"
"he warned against the use of narcotic drugs"

means.word_mean: 4. a task performed or problem solved in order to develop skill or understanding;

sentences.sentence: "you must work the examples at the end of each chapter in the textbook"

means.word_mean: 5. (usually plural) a ceremony that involves processions and speeches;
2. carry out or practice; as of jobs and professions;

sentences.sentence: "She works out in the gym every day"

auth_sentence.content: We get a lot less exercise in everyday living.
auth_sentence.res_content: We get a lot less exercise in everyday living.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We get a lot less exercise in everyday living.

auth_sentence.content: The best memory enhancer is exercise, Snyder says.
auth_sentence.res_content: The best memory enhancer is exercise, Snyder says.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The best memory enhancer is exercise, Snyder says.

auth_sentence.content: I am an exercise buff, always have been.
auth_sentence.res_content: I am an exercise buff, always have been.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I am an exercise buff, always have been.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表动词,表示"……化,做等"; 2. 表名词,"物品,状态"

stems_affixes.word_buile: ex出+erc力量+ise物品,状态→n.练习,习题;训练,锻练
merchand=merchant商人+ise物品,状态→商人的东西→商品
mort死+ise物品,状态→木头敲进榫眼便使不再动摇
treat治疗,研究+ise物品,状态→n.论文
turquo=turkish土耳其的+ise物品,状态→绿松石来自土耳其而出名
author作家+ise……化,做等→允许其写作→许可,批准
authorise[v.授权,委任;许可,批准]→v.授权,批准
critic批评家+ise……化,做等→v.批评,批判
ex出+erc力量+ise……化,做等→v.训练,锻练;行使
fertile肥沃的+ise……化,做等→v.使受精;施肥于,使肥沃

stems_affixes.value_cn: 使复活,使重新充满活力
stems_affixes.word_buile: re重新+vital生命的+ise……化,做等→重新活

Sentence.sentence: Walking, if you do it vigorously enough, is the overall best exercise for regular physical activity.

My colleagues and I are studying something called augmented reality (a field of computer research dealing with the combination of real-world and virtual reality)," said Christopher Dede, professor in learning technologies at Harvard University, "Alien Contact," for example, is an exercise developed for middle-school students who use hand-held devices that can determine their location.
Because so many of our modern technologies and services depend on oil, nations, corporations, and institutions that control the trade in oil exercise extraordinary power
We learn from the passage that in today's world, whoever monopolizes the oil market will be able to exercise extraordinary power.

sentences.cn: 适当的锻炼对你有好处。

sentences.en: Please do that exercise over again.
The captain set his soldiers various exercises.
sentences.cn: 上尉让他的士兵做各种操练。

sentences.en: Voting is the exercise of a civil right.

means.word_mean: 锻炼, 训练; 练习

sentences.en: Every day I exercise before I go to sleep.
We should constantly exercise our muscles.
sentences.cn: 我们应当经常锻炼肌肉。

sentences.en: The king cannot exercise much political power.
sentences.cn: 国王不能行使很多政治权力。

means.word_mean: 施加或产生(影响、作用)，影响，发挥(威力)

sentences.en: It exercised a strong influence towards goodwill between the two great English speaking peoples.
sentences.cn: 这件事对两个讲英语的伟大民族之间的友好亲善发挥了巨大作用。

means.word_mean: 使忙碌；使费尽心力；占去…的精力和注意力

sentences.en: This is a problem which is much exercising the minds of teachers.
sentences.cn: 这是一个十分吸引教师们注意的问题。

jushi.english: You've fattened out during the winter, you should take some exercises to lose weight.
jushi.chinese: 经过一冬天,你又长胖了,该运动运动减减肥了。

jushi.english: His stories showed considerable exercise of the imagination.
The underweight child has begun to fill out after regular exercises.
jushi.chinese: 这个偏瘦的孩子在进行了一段有规律的锻炼后开始长壮了。
